info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:26PM EDT until March 31 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BROOME...SOUTHWESTERN DELAWARE...SOUTH CENTRAL CHENANGO...SUSQUEHANNA AND NORTHWESTERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 526 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Franklin to near Afton to near Sherman to Gibson, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Walton, Sanford, Colchester, Susquehanna, Deposit, Susquehanna Depot, Springville, Montrose and Dimock. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
